results.title: Frenzy [DVD]
results.brief_description: Hitchcock’s penultimate film and his first made in England for 20 years, ‘Frenzy’ was concerned with many of the same preoccupations that dominated his earlier work including those around the motifs of the doppelganger, the wrong man and violent sexual deviance. Post-Carnaby London is terrorised by a rapist-murderer known as the ‘Necktie Killer’. An innocent ex-R.A.F. pilot, down on his luck, is accused of the murders and condemned to life imprisonment but a police inspector continues to have doubts about his guilt. Mixing black-humour and slapstick with disturbing sexual violence, the film received the critical praise denied his three previous films but was not a commercial success. Cast includes Jon Finch, Alec McCowen, Barry Foster and Barbara Leigh-Hunt. Screenplay by Anthony Schaffer, based on Arthur Le Bern’s novel ‘ Goodbye Piccadilly, Hello Leicester Square’. Photographed by Gil Taylor. Edited by John Jympson. Music by Ron Goodwin.

results.title: French twist = Gazon maudit [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Renn Productions, TF1 Films productions, Les Films Flan, Canal+, Pierre Grunstein and Josiane Balasko
results.brief_description: Josiane Balasko wrote, directed and starred in this French comedy of manners about fidelity and modern marriage. Loli (Victoria Abril) is a Spanish woman who has given up a career as a dancer for the role of suburban housewife. Her French husband, Laurent (Alain Chabat), is a real estate agent and chronic philanderer. Loli knows little of his extensive exploits, bar one affair when he was caught in the act. One day a van breaks down out the front of Loli’s house and the driver, Marijo (Balasko), comes in search of assistance. Marijo, a free-spirited lesbian, falls for Loli, who reciprocates her lust. Being displaced in the marital bed by a lesbian horrifies Laurent but his outrage is baseless, as his own transgressions have been revealed. Thus ensues a comic set-up involving love, sex, marriage and a battle of sexuality. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: French kiss
results.creator_credit: Working Title Films, Prufrock Pictures, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, PolyGram Filmed Entertainment, Tim Bevan, Eric Fellner, Meg Ryan, Kathryn F. Galan and Lawrence Kasdan
results.brief_description: Kevin Kline and Meg Ryan star in this romantic comedy about two people stuck in Paris, France. The most romantic city in the world. A place where anything can happen. And it does!
results.creator_credit_for_label: Working Title Films, Prufrock Pictures, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, PolyGram Filmed Entertainment, Tim Bevan, Eric Fellner, Meg Ryan, Kathryn F. Galan and Lawrence Kasdan

results.title: French cancan
results.creator_credit: Franco London Film (Paris), Louis Wipf and Jean Renoir
results.brief_description: Beautifully photographed, this comedy-drama chronicles the revival of Paris’ most notorious dance as it tells the story of a theater producer who turns a humble washerwoman into a star at the Moulin Rouge. Renoir’s return to film-making in France after 15 years absence is an exuberant, affectionate homage to the theatre of ‘La Belle Epoque’ (Edith Piaf and Tatachou appear briefly as stars of the day.) It also gave him the opportunity to work with Gabin again, having made three films with him in the 1930s. Cast includes Jean Gabin, Francoise Arnoul and Maria Felix. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Free Willy 3: the rescue
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Monarchy Enterprises B. V., Regency Entertainment (USA), Jennie Lew-Tugend and Sam Pillsbury
results.brief_description: Willy’s best friend, Jesse (Jason James Richter), is working with his mentor Randolph (August Schellenberg) monitoring whales off the Pacific Northwest coast. He befriends a young boy, Max, who shares Jesse’s love for whales. Max’s fisherman father however possesses a mysterious secret linked to the depleting orca population and it is up to Jesse and Max to embark on a rescue mission to save the whales. An entertaining family movie that is as much about whale conservation as it is about two boys love for whales. Also starring Annie Corley, Vincent Berry and Patrick Kilpatrick.

results.title: Free Willy 2: the adventure home
results.creator_credit: Shuler-Donner, Donner Productions, Lauren Shuler, Jennie Lew-Tugend and Dwight Little
results.brief_description: Jesse is reunited with his Orca friend Willy who has rejoined his family in the wild. Willy becomes trapped by an oil spill fire and Jesse is determined to rescue Willy even if it means risking his own life. Action packed adventure with superb photography, this is a film to be shared by all the family and lovers of whales.

results.title: Free Willy
results.creator_credit: Studio Canal+, Regency Enterprises, Alcor Films, Jennie Lew-Tugend, Lauren Shuler and Simon Wincer
results.brief_description: This is a heart warming and touching story about the friendship that develops between an abandoned child living in a foster home and an Orca (Killer Whale) who is confined in a too-small tank at Pacific Northwest aquatic park. At night Willy cries out to his family who frolic in the nearby bay. No-one can undestand his cries and moods - no one except Jesse (Jason James Richter) a 12 year old boy who knows what it is like to be without a family.

results.title: Freaky Friday
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Ron Miller and Gary Nelson
results.brief_description: A young Jodie Foster stars as Annabel Andrews, a precocious 13 year old who experiences a Friday unlike any other. Annabel and her mother simultaneously switch identities. While Annabel’s mother struggles through her daughter’s typing exam, band practice and unusual eating habits, Annabel is faced with running the household and looking after her younger brother. Both discover the other’s life is not as easy as they first imagined and things change for the better when they regain their own identities. Based on the book by Mary Rodgers. Cast includes Barbara Harris, John Astin, Patsy kelly, Dick Van patten, Vicki Schreck.

results.title: Freaks
results.brief_description: This controversial film was banned for over thirty years in some countries, including Australia. Using a group of circus and carnival performers who were all regarded as “freaks of nature” this unsettling film is about a malicious young woman who weds a carnival manager in order to gain his wealth. Her cruel treatment of the various circus performers prompts them to exact a vicious revenge. The final scenes in this movie are possibly some of the most harrowing in horror cinema history.

results.title: Frantic
results.creator_credit: Mount Company, Warner Bros Pictures, Thom Mount, Tim Hampton and Roman Polanski
results.brief_description: Dr. Richard Walker (Harrison Ford), an American cardiologist, is plunged into an emotional nightmare when he discovers his wife has mysteriously vanished during their visit to Paris. He sets out to find her, and begins to fear the city itself as he grapples with a bewildering web of language, locale, laissez-faire cops and indifferent bureaucrats. Walker’s only chance at finding his wife alive seems to rest with a streetwise waif with underworld connections (Emmanuelle Seigner). Cast also includes Betty buckley, JHohn Mahoney, Jimmie Ray Weeks, David Huddleston.
